text: By the end of the day, I felt drained, so I let myself slow down. I dimmed the lights, put on some soft background music, and just tried to unwind. I organized a few things around my room and wrote down some thoughts I didn’t want to forget. It wasn’t an exciting evening, but it helped me reset. I think I’m starting to realize that ending the day quietly—without screens blasting in my face or rushing around and actually makes a big difference. I’m going to try to make this a habit.
title: Ending on a Quiet Note
